revised_title: Turbulent Boundary Layer Flow Noise Generation over a Rough Wall
tldr: The article examines the production of sound by turbulent boundary layer flow over a rough wall, based on Lighthill's theory of aerodynamic noise. It explores how surface irregularities affect the boundary layer-generated noise and how the intensity of the sound produced varies with the main stream velocity and boundary-layer thickness. The study also compares the theoretical predictions with experimental data, showing that the shape of the roughness noise spectrum is well modeled by the theory.
